div.p: Value set consisting of the answers Detected (Present) and NotDetected (Absent). The terms detected and not detected are preferred because they reflect outcomes of experimental observation, while present and absent suggest ground truth. This value set reconciles or combines LOINC answer lists LL956-4, LL750-1, LL744-4, LL955-6, LL3950-4, LL3250-9, LL2872-1, LL2410-0, LL2355-7.

description.value: Value set consisting of the answers Detected (Present) and NotDetected (Absent). The terms detected and not detected are preferred because they reflect outcomes of experimental observation, while present and absent suggest ground truth. This value set reconciles or combines LOINC answer lists LL956-4, LL750-1, LL744-4, LL955-6, LL3950-4, LL3250-9, LL2872-1, LL2410-0, LL2355-7.

display.value: Equivocal. Equivocal represents a borderline value, too close to call; for example, a value very close to a cut-off between positive and negative.
Indeterminate. Indeterminate means the results were uninterpretable, or cannot be determined; technical issues prevented obtaining a valid result.
